item.title: Boobs are Back in Far Cry 4 Following Global Censorship Mishap
item.content:encoded:
https://insider-gaming.com/far-cry-4-boobs-are-back/

Ubisoft has returned the boobs to far Cry 4 following a mistake which censored the game worldwide.

Following our report earlier today which brought further light to the situation that Ubisoft had apparently censored the nudity in Far Cry 4, the official Far Cry account replied to our post to clarify the situation.

“To clarify, the update was the result of a mistake during deployment. Content intended specifically for the Japanese version of the game was accidentally pushed to the global Steam version,” they said.

They continued, “The team has since corrected the error by reuploading the proper global files to Steam. If players are still seeing anything unusual, restarting Steam and checking for updates should resolve it. Just to reassure everyone: there are no plans to censor Far Cry. This was purely a regional packaging error and has now been fully addressed. Thank you“

So fear not, boobs have once again returned to Far Cry 4.

Ubisoft community developer Patricia Brochu-Gagné also took to Reddit to further clarify the situation saying, “This was simply an error tied to a specific regional build, and it’s now been corrected.”

Far Cry 4 went on to sell over 10 million copies during the PlayStation 4 / Xbox One generation and to some, is considered one of the better Far Cry titles in the series.

item.title: ‘Best Selling’ Drug Dealer Simulator is Coming to Xbox Consoles on April 16, PlayStation 5 TBA
item.content:encoded:
https://insider-gaming.com/drug-dealer-simulator-xbox/

Movie Games has announced that Drug Dealer Simulator will be coming to Xbox One and Xbox Series X|S consoles on April 16, with a PlayStation 5 release to come at a later date.

In the new press release, it was said that Drug Dealer Simulator has already surpassed over “1 million buyers” on PC – a total amounting to some $16 million in revenue.

Originally, the announcement was made a few weeks ago, but the recent PR email seems, at least at face value, that they are also trying to capitalise on the highly-successful Schedule 1.

Schedule 1 released on March 29, and recently hit a peak concurrent playercount of 414,000, with a 24-hour peak of 329,000 concurrent players at the time of writing. At the moment, Schedule 1 is yet to announce a console release, so it makes sense that a rival drug dealer simulator would try and get ahead with an Xbox and PlayStation release… I guess.

Climb to the top in Drug Dealer Simulator

Your goal? Power, money, and respect. Be careful with your actions. Don’t screw with your clients… too much. Cooperate with the right people, don’t get caught, and you might just live long enough to spend your fortune!

Who needs money if you can’t spend it, right? Use your profits to either grow your gang, buy new equipment, hire some muscle, train them, or get yourself a mansion to show off your wealth.

Cash, drugs, and rock’n’roll… or something like that.

GAME FEATURES:

  • Receive smuggled shipments from the cartel;
  • Safely make your way to your hideout with the merchandise;
  • Create your own recipes, divide portions to prepare dope for sale;
  • Organise your distribution starting from singular junkie sales up to wholesale transactions with local gangs;
  • Strategically avoid police patrols and DEA ambushes;
  • Raise your influence and gain territory. Hire people, make deals with gangsters;
  • Set up labs, train lab assistants and produce your own hard drugs;
  • Fight against a rival cartel and gain independence in your drug business;
  • Buy a mansion, decorate it and show off your wealth;
  • Grow your business, invest your money and face new dangers and dilemmas as you climb the criminal ladder.

Will you be picking up Drug Dealer Simulator on the Xbox One or Xbox Series S|X? Let me know in the comments, or hit us up on the Insider Gaming forum.

item.title: Marvel Rivals Season 2 Patch Notes: All Buffs, Nerfs, and Balance Changes
item.content:encoded:
https://insider-gaming.com/marvel-rivals-season-2-patch-notes-all-buffs-nerfs-and-balance-changes/

Marvel Rivals Season 2 is fast approaching and set to introduce two new heroes, a new map, and a slew of changes to both its features list and gameplay. As is the case with any update at the start of a season, the game is getting a balance update to dozens of heroes, applying buffs and nerfs to a majority of the playable characters.

Ahead of the launch of next season on April 11th, here are all the balance updates, buffs, and nerfs to Marvel Rivals heroes coming in Season 2.

All Marvel Rivals Season 2 Balance Changes, Hero Buffs and Nerfs

In their most recent Dev Vision video, the Marvel Rivals team said they are aware of a number of heroes struggling, and the Season 2 updates reflect those concerns. Most heroes receiving a change are getting a buff of some kind, while only a few are getting a kind of nerf.
